entry.definition: the equipment required for a task or sport
a mechanism consisting of ropes, pulley blocks, hooks, or other things for lifting heavy objects.
an act of playing the ball, or attempting to do so, when it is in the possession of an opponent

examples.text: he was only prevented from scoring by a fine tackle

entry.definition: a player who lines up next to the end along the line of scrimmage.
make determined efforts to deal with (a problem or difficult task)

examples.text: police have launched an initiative to tackle rising crime

entry.definition: try to take the ball from (an opponent) by intercepting them

examples.text: the first scoring chance came when Orrell tackled Webb
he tackled well and covered expertly
